channel.title: Huge Showcase
channel.description: Showcase of huge widgets and js / css ideas and POC's

item.title: Huge Inc. Full Screen Menu
item.description:
About

    This is an abstraction of the menu used on the Huge Inc. site. It is a fullscreen menu, with a subtle animation on the menu items when they fade in. In fact, there are several improvements over the original implementation. Namely, no javascript is used to calculate the height / spacing of the menu items when viewed on different screen-sizes, orientations. Welcome the new vh and vw css selectors*

    * not valid in IE8

    Demo
    • About
    • Projects
    • Work
    • Blog
    • Clients
    • Contact

    Click the burger in the top left of your screen.

    Prereqs

    jQuery

    Compatibility

    • IE8+
    • webkit, Opera, FF
    • mobile webkit, android

    Options

    Name type default description
    nav container string #huge-nav The container of the navigation DOM tree

    Events

    Event Type Description
    open This event fires immediately when nav is opened.
    close This event fires immediately when nav is closed.

item.title: Parallax
item.description:
About

    Parallax. Moves stuff on scroll.

    A Note On Approaches

    There are several ways to apprach building a parallax effect on a site. Paul Lewis has a great overview on the popular techiniques and their pros and cons. In brief:

    • absolute positioning: parallax is achieved via positioning elements absolutely (this technique also includes positioning a background image attachment). In general, this is the absolute worst way to do parallax from a performance point of view. Everything must be recalculated and re-painted on scroll, so avoid this if possible. The upside: you can support IE8 this way.
    • 3D transforms: how the code herein operates. We offload elements in their own render layer to the GPU for X- or Y-transforms. Almost the most efficient (see below), but still very flexible and easy to implement. Browsers need to support transforms.
    • canvas: one fixed element background (a canvas), that animates on scroll. Elements are placed into the canvas and moved about on scroll -- this is the most efficient, but difficult to implement (or impossible if you wish to use existing DOM elements).

    Download

    Stash

    Get it from the Stash repo

    Bower

    bower install parallax

    Demo

    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.

    Prereqs

    jQuery

    Compatibility

    • IE9+
    • Firefox, Webkit, Opera
    • no mobile

    Code

    parallax.init({
	el: '.parallax'
});

    Options

    Name type default description
    el string .parallax selector or jQuery object of elements to parallax-ify

item.title: Huge Inc. Slider
item.description:
Huge.Slider

Full page scroll jacking slider that's touch friendly

Prereqs

Compatibility

  • IE9+
  • Chrome, Opera, lynx

Usage

$(document).ready(function() {
        new Slider();
  });

section {
    position: relative;
}
html, body, article {
    height: 100%;
}

html, body {
    overflow: hidden;
}

Options

Name type default description
animation boolean or the string 'static' true Includes a modal-backdrop element. Alternatively, specify static for a backdrop which doesn't close the modal on click.

item.title: AutoCompleter
item.description:
About

AutoCompleter is a light wieght stand alone module can be used for filtering data or auto completion of user input. It work on desktop, phone and tablet.

Concept

AutoCompleter caches filterable data in an array, and each data key matches their markup order. By filtering the cached array to locate what markup to hide or show and reludce the amount markup to append to DOM.

Compatibility

  • IE9+
  • Chrome, Opera, safari
  • iOS 6+

Demo

Filter Existing Markup Example

  • Alaska
  • Arizona

  • Texas
  • Utah
  • Vermont

Filter Existing Markup Example 2

Filter AJAX Example

Filter AJAX Example

Filter with click

Excited Dance Eyebrow

Code

	//to filter markup
	markupFilter = new AutoCompleter(document.querySelector('#auto-complete'));


	//to override markup filter function

Api

item.title: Huge SASS Library
item.description:
General

Circle with Arrow

Name:
circle-with-arrow
Arguments
Size:
Size of the circle you want
Circle color:
Color of the circle
Arrow color:
Arrow color you want (durr)

Example

Code:
@include circle-with-arrow(50px, $magenta, #000);
Result:

Card Flip

name
card-flip
Arguments
Direction:
Direction you want it to flip, left right up down (corner is in there but hasn't been tested in IE, but who cares AMIRIGHT?)
Height:
Card height
Width:
Card width
Perspective:
Set the animation perspective
Duration:
The durations of the animation

Example

Code:
@include card-flip(left, 200px, 200px, 1000, 1s);
Result:
1
2

Page Curl

name
page-curl

Example

Code
@include page-curl
Result

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.

CSS arrow

Name:
arrow
Arguments
Direction:
Direction for the arrow to point
Color:
Arrow color
Width:
Card width
Size:
Pixel size of the arrow
I can't take credit for writing this, it came from here

Example

Code
@include arrow(right, red, 10px);
Result:

Arrow Button

Name:
button-arrow

Example

Code:
@include button-arrow
Result:

Huge Navigation Bullets

name
huge-bullets
Code
@include huge-bullets
Result

Functions

Pixel To Ems

Name:
huge-em
Type:
function
Arguments
Pixels:
Px value you want to convert to ems
Base:
Base px value to convert the ems off of

Maybe some more stuff here to explain about the plugin if it's kind of involved, and now some lorem ipsum. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec bibendum nunc a sapien tincidunt, ullamcorper vestibulum sem hendrerit. Morbi ac erat odio. Aliquam eget interdum libero, id bibendum felis. Nullam vulputate fringilla fringilla. Maecenas viverra sapien in justo feugiat, eget rutrum ipsum laoreet. Sed at lorem at orci condimentum condimentum eu tincidunt lectus. Praesent vehicula dignissim orci ut faucibus. Sed et molestie augue. Fusce et sagittis nisi. Vestibulum enim urna, pretium id ligula semper, aliquam blandit tortor. Praesent fringilla felis sed elit tincidunt, ut interdum lectus faucibus. Nunc cursus non lectus et sagittis.

Example

Code:
div#example {
// first pair
&.m-1 { width: huge-em(300); }
&.m-2 { width: 300px; }
// second pair
&.m-3, &.m-4 { font-size: 20px; }
&.m-3 { width: huge-em(400, 20); }
&.m-4 { width: 400px; }
}
Result:

Example 2
Example 3
Example 4

Typography

Stuff to eventually go here

Format

Unstyled List

Name:
huge-list-unstyled
Arguments
no-margin
whether or not you want a margin

Example

Code:
ul { @include list-unstyled; }
Result:
  • Unstyled Item 1
  • Unstyled Item 2
  • Unstyled Item 3

item.title: Flexicarousel
item.description:
About

    A flexible carousel that works on both desktop and mobile devices, and is compleletely responsive. Additionally, there is a strict separation of state and style. That is to say, javascript maintains the state of the carousel, while the CSS is responsible for the presentation and display of this state

    Problem

    A carousel may work fine on desktop, where styles are added or removed by the Javascript causing the position of the carousel's slides to update accordingly. Different styles can allow for a variety of interesting transitions and effects using CSS3 transforms and transitions. However, this paradigm suffers on mobile, where touch interactions and continuous control over a slide's position (ie. via dragging) are desired. Touch-enabled carousels usually achieve this by positioning a slide manually via translate(); the result of this approach is that the "desktop" CSS-based system of control is not compatible with this inlined manual positioning. Workarounds usually revolve around managing all effects, transitions, etc. within the Javascript -- which always results in larger files sizes, more instantiation arguments and custom animation functions.

    One architecture may work well for mobile, but is less than optimal on desktop; contrariwise, using CSS to position a slide works well on desktop but is undermined by a native touch-UI paradigm.

    Solution

    Flexicarousel enables a touch-based interface (ie. sliding slides via dragging) while also respecting the separation of state and behaviour. You can swipe to drag a slide yet still use CSS to control how the slide transitions will behave. You can also choose to change slides by using the exposed API. The carousel works on both desktop and mobile, using only CSS to control the look and feel. The result is smaller codebase while achieving the best of both approaches.

    Download

    Stash

    Get it from the Stash repo

    Bower

    bower install flexicarousel

    Example

    Sliding transition

    • 1
    • 2
    • 3
    • 4
    Prev Next

    Fade transition

    • 1
    • 2
    • 3
    • 4
    Prev Next

    Multiple transitions (not infinite)

    • 1
    • 2
    • 3
    • 4
    Prev Next

    Tabs

    • 1
    • 2
    • 3
    • 4
    one
    two
    three
    four

    Prereqs

    none

    Compatibility

    • IE8+
    • Firefox, Chrome, Opera
    • iOS, Android

    Code

    // using jQuery

var bullets = $('#one .indicators span');
var car1 = $('#one').carousel({
	beforeSlide: function() { bullets.removeClass() },
	afterSlide: function(i) { bullets.eq(i).addClass('active') }
});

$('#one .prev').click(function(e){
	e.preventDefault();
	car1.carousel('prev');
});
$('#one .next').click(function(e){
	e.preventDefault();
	car1.carousel('next');
});

$('nav span').each(function(i){
	$(this).click(function() {
		car1.carousel('go', i);
	});
});


// vanilla js

var container2 = document.querySelector('#two');
var car2 = new Carousel(container2);

container2.querySelector('.prev').addEventListener('click', function(e){
	e.preventDefault();
	car2.prev();
});

container2.querySelector('.next').addEventListener('click', function(e){
	e.preventDefault();
	car2.next();
});

    Nitty Gritty Api Stuff

    Options

    Name type default description
    activeClass string active Class to use on the active slide.
    beforeClass string before Class to use on the previous slide.
    afterClass string after Class to use on the next slide.
    slideWrap string .wrap The selector to use when searching for the slides' container. This is used only to bind touch events to, on mobile.
    slides string li The selector to use when searching for slides within the slideWrap container.
    infinite boolean true Enable infinite scrolling or not
    beforeSlide function undefined A function to execute before sliding. It is passed to and from indices.
    afterSlide function undefined A function to execute after sliding. It is passed the new current index.
    noTouch boolean false if you'd like to disable the touch UI for whatever reason

    Methods

    Next Slide
    carousel.next()
    Previous Slide
    carousel.prev()
    Go To Slide
    carousel.to(i)
    Go To Slide
    carousel.destroy()

item.title: Chusy Responsive Sass Framework
item.description:
About

    CHUSY is a framework modeled after SUSY, its goal is to be like SUSY, but not opaque and confusing. It makes prototyping and maintenance of multi-breakpoint liquid grids fast, easy, and fun!

    There are two flavors: "Original" and "Flexible Gutter", which are very much alike. While both are fully fluid, there are differences is how the columns and gutters work. Here is a brief overview:

    Original

    How it works: Orginal takes base width, column width, gutter-width and column inner padding to calculate precise percentages for each element.

    • Pro: User can define Column padding and gutter width with a specific number, which will be converted to a percentage automatically. It gives user more options to control the look of the grid.
    • Cons: Column padding and gutter are fluid. It can't create fixed padding and gutter. It requires some level of calculation to set up the grid.

    If you have any question about the Original, please contact Choshun Snyder

    Flexible Gutter

    How it works: Flexible gutter gets the column width by taking 100% divided by the total # columns. It uses column inner padding to create a gutter.

    • Pro: User can define gutters with a fixed number or percentage to create fixed or fluid gutter look. No calculation for setting up the grid, simply enter the total column.
    • Cons: Since the column uses column inner padding to fake the gutter, you may need extra markup if more padding is needed between the content and its parent column

    If you have any question about the Flexible Gutter variant, please contact Miranda Li

    Download

    Stash repo

    Installation

    Original

    Copy and paste _base.scss and _mixins.scss into a working compass project (http://compass-style.org/install/)

    Reference _base and _mixins in needed scss files with:

    @import "base";
@import "mixins";

    Done!

    Flexible gutter

    Copy and paste _base.scss and _mixins-flexible-gutter.scss into a working compass project (http://compass-style.org/install/)

    Reference _base and _mixins-flexible-gutter in needed scss files with:

    @import "base";
@import "mixins-flexible-gutter";

    Done!

    Options

    Making breakpoints

    In _base.scss there are breakpoint variables that are defined by browser viewport widths.

    For example:

    $small-screen: small-screen 0 599px;

    $small-screen is a breakpoint variable that defines the threshold width of 0 to 599px.

    This is the ONLY place you'll need to define breakpoints for the whole project.

    You did it! good job

    Making grids

    At the top of _mixins is the mixin at-breakpoint($viewport).

    For each breakpoint there is an associated grid configuration. This creates the liquid grid that has unique column, gutter, and grid padding in percent.

    In the case of using our previous breakpoint $small-screen we define the grid:

    // if the first value of the variable $small-screen (it's value being: "small-screen 0 599px") is small screen...
@if nth($viewport, 1) == small-screen {
	// at base ideal width of 400...
	$base-width: 400px;

	// the columns will be this ideal px width (which in turn produce the number of liquid columns)
	$column-width: 43.3333333333333px;

 	// with the gutters of the columns being 20px
 	$gutter-width: 20px;

	// the grid padding of the whole grid on the left and right will be 20px
	$grid-padding: 20px;

	// don't worry about me
	$active-width: $base-width - (2 * $grid-padding);

	// another thing that is derived from previous values
	$inner-padding: 100 / ($active-width / $grid-padding) * 1%;
}

    This creates a 6 column liquid grid for the breakpoint $small-screen.

    This is the ONLY place you define grids.

    NOTE: It is important that you calculate the values as precise as possible (ie 43px WILL look way different than 43.33333333333333333333px). Don't trust the designs, plug in the cols/gutters/grid padding and make sure it equals the defined ideal width.

    Huzzah!

    Using the Responsive Grid

    Original

    We have breakpoints from _base, and unique liquid grids for each breakpoint defined in at-breakpoint() in _mixins, how do we use these in our scss files?

    With the mixin span-columns() inside the at-breakpoint() mixin of course!

    Example 1
    #wrapper {
	@include at-breakpoint($small-screen) {
		#header {
			@include span-columns(3);
		}
	}
}

    At viewport $small-screen (0-599px defined in _base), the #header will span 3 columns, in this case 3 columns will be ~50%, cause the grid ends up being a 6 col grid (see step 3)

    Example
    #wrapper {
	@include at-breakpoint($large-screen) {
		#header {
			@include span-columns(3);
		}
	}
}

    At viewport $large-screen (1000px up as defined in _base) the same exact #header div will be at ~25%, 'cause that grid ends up being 12 columns as defined in _mixins.

    That's it!

    The rest of the mixins are just commented frosting on the delicious sponge cake that is CHUSY.

    Flexible Gutter

    In the flexible gutter version of chusy, `column width` is 100% divided by the total columns. The gutter is created by the padding on the columns. You can specify gutter width in _base.scss `$gutter-width`. You can define total number of columns in the break point mixin: 

    //in _base.scss
$gutter-width: 30px; // it creates 15px padding left and right on a column

// in _mixins-flexible-gutter.scss
// if the first value of the variable $small-screen (it's value being: "small-screen 0 599px") is small screen...
@if nth($viewport, 1) == small-screen {

 	// defines total columns
 	$total-columns: 6;

 	// calculate each column's width
	$column-width: (100 /$total-columns) * 1%;

	// defines the margin between content and the browser border.
	$page-margin: 3%;

}

    Define the column width with span-columns();

    Example
    .side-content {
	// .side-content will take up 3 columns as its width: 3 * 100% / 12 = 25%
	@include span-columns(3);

	// .side-content will take up 6 columns as its width: 6 * 100% / 6 = 100%
	@include at-breakpoint($small-screen) {
		@include span-columns(6);
	}
}

    Demo

    There is example markup and scss in the repo. Please have a look in the /demo folder

    Projects using `Chusy Original`
    • Exxon
    Projects using `Chusy flexible gutter`
    • Diageo stay in out
    • TD Olympics
    • NYULangone
    Fork if u cry evry time.
